thread.title: Supergirl: Teri Hatcher Teases Costume For Mysterious Role
thread.title_full: Supergirl: Teri Hatcher Teases Costume For Mysterious Role

author: Matthew Mueller
title: Supergirl: Teri Hatcher Teases Costume For Mysterious Role
text:
Supergirl: Teri Hatcher Teases Costume For Mysterious Role Matthew Mueller Back to Article Image of 
Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman fans were ecstatic to learn that Lois actress Teri Hatcher has been cast in The CW's Supergirl series. What character she is playing is still a mystery, a recent post indicates she will have her very own costume. 
No name has been attached to Hatcher, but she will be playing the main villain for the rest of season 2. If you're going to go against Supergirl, you better have some armor, and Hatcher shared a glimpse of hers on Twitter ( via HeroicHollywood ). She shared an image with the caption "Well I'm definitely gettin some love in the wardrobe room @TheCWSupergirl. Can't think of a more fun place to be." 
Well I'm definitely gettin some love in the wardrobe room @TheCWSupergirl . Can't think of a more fun place to be. pic.twitter.com/OuARTEKuyk — Teri Hatcher (@HatchingChange) February 15, 2017 
It seemed to be some basic black plating, so it's hard to pin down any specific character. By the time the designers are done, though, rest assured she's more than hold her own against National City's resident hero. 
You can view the official description for the next episode of Supergirl below. 
When Mr. Mxyzptlk (guest star Peter Gadiot), a magical imp, shows up on Earth and declares his love for Kara (Melissa Benoist), she tries to let him down easy, thinking him harmless. However, he decides it’s a challenge and starts to wreak havoc on National City. Mon-El (Chris Wood) has seen beings like Mr. Mxyzptlk on Daxam and knows how dangerous they can be. He and Kara argue over how to get rid of Mr. Mxyzptlk, further straining their relationship. Meanwhile, Alex (Chyler Leigh) and Maggie (Floriana Lima) celebrate their first Valentine’s Day together. 
Stefan Pleszczynski directed the episode written by Jessica Queller & Sterling Gates. 
Distributed worldwide by Warner Bros. International Television Distribution, SUPERGIRL is executive produced by Greg Berlanti (Arrow, The Flash), Ali Adler (The New Normal), Andrew Kreisberg (The Flash, Arrow) and Sarah Schechter (Blindspot, The Mysteries of Laura). Supergirl is based on the characters created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster and appearing in DC Comics , by special arrangement with the Jerry Siegel Family. 
"Mr. and Mrs. Mxyzptlk" episode of Supergirl airs Monday, February 20 at 8 p.m. ET/PT.
